reviews.review_msg: Betty truly cares about teaching her students. She puts time and thought into every class. That being said, she expects you to stay on top of the readings and engage with the course content--but her passion for her field is contagious. Betty's course was more than worth my time and money and she is a quality educator. Highly recommended!

Gives a very heavy reading syllabus, and is a very tough marker. She's highly respected with an international research pull, and this shows. Not the most approachable prof, but kind once you get to know her. Only take her if you're willing to work, because if you succeed she'll recognize that.

Overall I liked this course, but somethings should be known. 1) participation is mandatory and she tracks down how much you speak in class, 2) she knows her stuff, but gives you too much info and you get away from the primary text, 3)STRICT on grammar. I would suggest seeing her in office hours she is very helpful, but marking is really specific

I've taken two courses with this professor so far - a 200-level and 400. She is smart, funny, and passionate. The classes are easy as long as you put a little effort in, but they're fun and enthusiastic. She's more than willing to allow discussion and give help to students who come see her, and is incredibly friendly. I recommend her at all levels!
